title: Pretty good but

title: Main concept and most functionality is there; some improvement suggestions
comment: App works well. Widgets are very customizable. I had a screen with 4x3 available, so I have a 4x1 widget with the major indices and a 4x2 widget with my current portfolio. I like that you can set the update frequency, and the widget shows when it last updated  It would be really cool if, rather than preset widget view options, you could choose what to put in each of the columns, a more modular approach. So you would go to widget settings, tap Column 1, and you'd be able to choose current price, daily price increase/decrease, total holdings increase/decrease, market cap, etc. Then you'd go to Columns 2, 3, and 4 and see the same options.  It would also be great if in stocks setup, you could drag stocks up and down to reorder them.  A total portfolio value option for the footer would be nice.  Some issues I have noticed: - Money market funds show $0.00 price. - ^DJI exhibits weird behavior. Sometimes the widget can't pull data for it when it can pull data for other indices. Other times the name doesn't appear at all, but its numbers do. - You can select multiple widget view checkboxes for a single widget. It seems to just go with the first one checked.

title: Not very KitKat friendly
comment: Very good, useful. A major problem is that the stock codes of each widget are not backed-up anywhere (although the "global" portfolio data is). When a widget borks, lost by the home app or accidentally deleted, you have to create a new widget and enter EVERY SINGLE stock code again. That happens rarely, but often enough to be a major irritation. A good solution would be to import the stock codes from a backup into a new widget... or be shown all the codes in the portfolio and check-mark the ones you want.

title: Perfect! Perfect! Perfect!
comment: Perfect! Perfect! Perfect! Well almost 99.9% perfect. Its just the stock/fx app I've been looking for. Displays stock and forex quotes from yahoo. Just enter the yahoo stock ticker and the widget displays them on the screen. Able to set scheduled updates, although the price update doesn't seem consistent.

title: Powerful, concise, simple.
comment: Forget all the extra fluff and storage waste common with other stock apps. This little guy gets the job done, and has a remarkably extensive tool set considering the lack of resource hogging. Thanks, dev, good work. Considering donating to get your pay widget now.
